title: Proton energy-angle distributions 70 keV - 6.8 MeV, often at 24 sec, SST Open, Wind 3DP - R. Lin/S. Bale (UC Berkeley)

parameters.name: FLUX
parameters.description: Proton number flux 70-6800 keV in 9 energy and 8 pitch angle bins (as energy-angle displays)

parameters.name: FLUX_byE_atA
parameters.description: Proton number flux at 8 pitch angles as spectrograms by energy. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['FLUX']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_DISPLAY_TYPE: default_dimensiony=ENERGY_filled,z=FLUX_byE_atA(1,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(2,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(3,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(4,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(5,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(6,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(7,*), z=FLUX_byE_atA(8,*)

parameters.name: FLUX_byE_atA_stackPA0
parameters.description: Proton number flux as a stack_plot of 9 energies at the Bin1 angle (often ~15 deg). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['FLUX']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.x_cdf_DISPLAY_TYPE: default_dimensiony=PANGLE,z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,1), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,2), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,3), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,4), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,5), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,6), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,7), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,8), z=FLUX_byA_atE(*,9)

parameters.name: PANGLE
parameters.description: Time-varying proton pitch angles in 8 angular bins

parameters.name: ENERGY_filled
parameters.description: ---> Time-varying proton energies in 9 channels. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function fix_sparse (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['ENERGY']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: VSW
parameters.description: SW Velocity vector (from ions and ground-based processing)

parameters.name: MAGF
parameters.description: Vector magnetic field

parameters.name: TIME
parameters.description: UNIX time; seconds since January 1, 1970
